sub_topic: Calculation of magnetic field due to a current-carrying generator
message_1: A generator coil consists of a circular-shaped loop with a radius of 0.1 meters and 50 turns. The current flowing through the coil is 5 amps. What is the magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the loop?
message_2:
To find the magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the loop, we can use the formula for the magnetic field at the center of a circular loop:

B = (μ₀ * I * N) / (2 * R)

where B is the magnetic field, μ₀ is the permeability of free space (4π × 10^(-7) Tm/A), I is the current, N is the number of turns, and R is the radius of the loop.

Plugging in the given values:

B = (4π × 10^(-7) Tm/A * 5 A * 50) / (2 * 0.1 m)

B = (4π × 10^(-7) * 5 * 50) / 0.2

B = (10π × 10^(-7) * 50) / 0.2

B = (500π × 10^(-7)) / 0.2

B = 2500π × 10^(-7) T

B ≈ 7.85 × 10^(-5) T

The magnitude of the magnetic field at the center of the loop is approximately 7.85 × 10^(-5) Tesla.
